newsitem.title: TAIWAN: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - February 12.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - February 12.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Taiwan press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
CHINA TIMES - Taiwan government to spend an estimated T$200 billion per year on urban development projects.
Police authorities to launch another crackdown on gangsters.
UNITED DAILY NEWS - Economics Ministry to announce by end-March timetable for liberalisation of oil products.
Stock market rallies past 7,400 points in the first trading session in the Year of Ox.
LIBERTY TIMES - Thirty-eight Taiwan passengers witness airplane hijack in China.
Government aims to raise Taiwan's global competitiveness.
COMMERCIAL TIMES - Oil price in Taiwan may rise by five percent in first half of 1997.
Five companies from mainland China are expected to join Taiwan's regional transshipment centre scheme.
ECONOMIC DAILY NEWS - Taiwan to delay eliminating import tariffs on eight products until 2002.
Taiwan dollar falls on the strength of U.S. dollar in overseas markets.
